1.content: What type of race are you?
1.title: Which Race?

choices: Beast blood of the werewolf, from the companions in Whiterun
Vampire lord from the far north
111.content: Do your veins run with pure Nord blood, or do they contain something far more sinister?
111.title: Only Nord blood?

1111.content:
[Heads-up this is going to be a M/M only route. Women may be mentioned or show up, but nothing past that. Expect nearly all forms of vore, including (mostly sexual) snuff, non-con, hypnosis, brutal fights and sex, and more.]


A nord like few others you know yourself as Eogr, and to your friends, foes, and even family you are 'The Devourer'. A title not to be made small, and is held by yourself and any that pursue a path like your's. You make your way across the holds by the virtue of your strength, study, and stealth, although what you put to the fullest usage is the well endowed body you were born into this world with.

That very same body is a wide and towering one that others could only dream of having...or being had by. Your broad shoulders frame your silhouette, but so too does your musclegut, powerful thighs, and mountainous pectorals. Between your legs swings a foreskin-covered cock that can swell to the size of an old tree's trunk, and beneath it a churning sack. When men look to your face they see bright yet cold blue eyes staring through them, broad nose and freckled face, and wide jaw that your thick beard grows from. Upon your head is a veritable mane of wavy hair, the copper and deep red tones blend together making a fiery display against any scenery. Underneath the furs and leathers made from beasts you've hunted is flesh carpeted in hair that displays your virility. You armor yourself with maille from time to time, and you ensure that your garb displays the men you've slaughtered during your travels.

You've lived a life of tales worth telling, but something tells you the next great saga is only beginning. Your body recognizes it too as churning noises erupt from all the methods you have at your disposal to take a man. As if rewarding a pet you rub over yourself in turn for such readiness for battle. You relish every opportunity to exert your will on the world, to it's fullest extent. A grin spreads across your face knowing you may find your hands molding the world to your every whim despite the strange tidings the land has.

You stand looking out at the world, but you realize after all of your reflection that you forgot your next destination... it seems you will have to gather your bearings.
1111.title: Pure Nord - Eogr the Devourer

11112.content:
You recall that you are on your way to visit your place of birth and raising. Rorikstead isn't a proper city, but it is a large area of farms and folk you know well. Nostalgia floods back of the times spent with your kin and friends, and your first tastes of the power you'd someday hold.

You lumber along the paths, and after some hours you see that the path forks ahead. You know from experience that they both lead to Rorikstead, but after time they've both changed. Whether you go high or go low you know both hold danger you must confront.


The first path to the right seems to be a pass, and your experience in travels tells you it's the perfect site for a bandit to ambush travelers. You think of how best to approach the situation, and decide if you take that route you'd be trying to find their camp and flip the usual narrative so that your prey is on the defensive. Bandits are used to being the one with the element of surprise, and usually fall into the fatal error of hesitating when they lose it from the start.

The second seems worn in a way you faintly recognize, but easier to tell is the potent musky scent coming from ahead. There's no doubt about it that giants and their mammoths are down that ways. You nearly catch your mind drifting at the thought of a massive man thrashing within your form, and your body already churns from how long it's been since you had slain one.


The decision awaits as to what your next fight will be...
11112.title: To your family in Rorikstead

choices: A brigade of Stormcloaks is moving along the road
A lone bandit fights a bear
A delicious looking traveler walks down the road
1112.content: The warm sun feels good on your dark fur, and although you prefer the darkness of caves, it's nice to escape the dingy bandit encampment of which you had made a filling meal. A belch breaks the silence. Bandits are greasy and digest too quickly to be considered a full meal. Still in beast form, you run through the trees.
1112.title: Beast Blood

choices: A woman in a white dress, a Dadra?
11123.content:
You begin to salivate as the lone man walks hardly a dozen feet in front of you. Your stomach grumbles. Shouldn't the Companians protect innocent people? Oh well, you think, nobody will notice one innocent life lost.
You spring from your hinging spot, pouncing on the man. He screams, but not before an enormous wolffish jaw closes in over his head. He struggles, but after only a couple powerful gulps, he slides into your belly where numerous humans, animals and others have met their end.
With a smile you pat your screaming belly, but the satisfied feeling is short lived.
"A werewolf!"
"A werewolf! To arms!"
Several Whiterun guards have spotted you and sprint up the hill, swords drawn. You growel as you feet the first man, imidiatly catching him in your maw and sending him down to your belly with ease. Guards left alive would tell of what happend here, and bodies would be a giveaway. In each of your massive hands your grab an attacking guard and stuff them both in your mouth. A gulp, hard belch and you're on to the next frightened man. He attempts to block your vorocious onslaught with a shield, but it shatters in your mighty maw, dooming him down into your belly.
You're beginning to enjoy yourself as you cram in two more guards, and then a third. The remaining guard flees, but you catch one in your powerful arm. He is pulled back into your gaping mouth, which snaps shut as he too slides down your throat.
You sit with your back against a tree, belly gurgling, groaning and churning its contents. The screams and shouting begin to subside as the struggling slows. Several hours later, you awake from your slumber to find yourself under a great deal of pressure.
Behind a huge tree you squat and relive yourself. The hide and cloth of armor and clothing broke down entirely in your stomach, only some metal armor and bones remain. The pile is massive, a slew of skulls and femurs, ribs and other bones.
It was an honor to feed such a powerful beast.
11123.title: A delicious looking traveler walks down the road

132.content: Your name is Narina Civonius, you're a beautiful brunette and an avid predator. Choose an archetype.
132.title: Female

1512.content:
You are a female Argonian named, Aney-Ra, though you prefer to be called Ra by close friends and family. You stand about 5ft 5in, with dark green scales covering your body from head to tail, and lighter, lime green scales covering your belly, breasts, neck, inner thighs and inner arms, making you very hard to spot in your home of Black Marsh, though would do you little good in the mostly snow covered nation of Skyrim, which is where you had just entered. Thankfully, you had entered in a heavily forested area, meaning it was easy for you to cross the border between Skyrim and Cyrodil, the heartland nation of Tamriel.

Currently, you were wearing leather armor, which nicely showed off your curvy body, with a heavy fur cloak on top of them, both of them protecting your body from the harsher climate that called Skyrim home. However, before you had even made it a mile into the forest, you would come across a road, which let to a small village. Unfortunately for you, a patrol of guards came by just as you came out of the forest. Normally they would have just ignored you and continued on their way, but the recent bandit attacks made them weary of strangers.

"Halt! Who goes there?" One of them shouted at you, their horses soon surrounding you, making any form of escape impossible.
"My name is Aney-Ra." You calmly reply, hoping that cooperating would mean you could continue on your way.
"What are you?" The same guard asks, all of them having their swords drawn and ready should you try and attack.
"I am an Argonian, from Black Marsh."
"One final question. Why are you here?"
1512.title: Female

1542.content: Your name is Diraris Salmaro, you are one of the many dunmer who sailed to the port of Windhelm thinking things would be better than they were in Morrowind or Solstheim. You have the trademark greyish skin along with dark red eyes and dark brown hair. What will your role be? Traditionally dark elves are seen as merchants, mages, or assassins for the Dark Brotherhood.
1542.title: Female

154232.content:
Being a rather young woman and having few valuable skills to offer the Nords of Windhelm you have taken to a role of a lady of the night.

"DIRARIS! your services are required", you had taken to working for a Nord named Rolf, a short and repulsive man, and the only one to hire Dunmer as whores in his Brothel. Conditions were poor, and the pay was poorer, though it was better than starving. You had been called to service a client, upon entering the lobby you saw, three people.

An Argonian merchant, he is 6'3" tall with a large muscular tail, his scales are a dark green
A nord guards woman, Still wearing her uniform, standing at 6'2" with pale skin and long auburn hair
An orc warrior, tallest among them he stands 7 foot tall with large bulging muscles

Which one chooses you to service them?
154232.title: whore

1552.content: Masters of the forge and fearsome brutes in combat. What gender are you?
1552.title: Orc

choices: To Winterhold, to become a mage
To Riften, to hone your skills as a thief
To Markarth, to find work as an Assassin
15521.content: you are Durzgo, a small and lithe being who has been rejected by his clan due to your lack of strength. Despite this you possess both agility and intelligence. With only the clothes on your back and a small dagger it is up to you to decide your fate, will you walk the path of an assassin or thief? Or will you head north to Winterhold so that you can learn to become a powerful mage?
15521.title: Male

choices: On wards to a life of pick pocketing and Robberies
155212.content: You set off to Riften, The cities poor law enforcement and high crime rates will provide an easy hunting ground, where you can hone your skills, and with some luck, net some gold whilst you're at it.
155212.title: To Riften, to hone your skills as a thief

1552121.content: Finally your on your way, it will take a few days to reach your destination, giving you time to hone your skills. You scan the area around you hoping to find an easy target now that your far enough from your clans stronghold, to the north you scan see a pair of travelers walking towards you, they haven't seen you yet giving you time to hide in the brush. Alternatively around 300 yards to your east, an alchemist is gathering reagents for his potions completely oblivious to his surroundings, who do you target?
1552121.title: On wards to a life of pick pocketing and Robberies

choices: try to intimidate him for his cash
Kill him and loot the body
15521212.content: Your new to this highway mans lifestyle, and getting in over your head is the last thing you need to be doing, and besides alchemists make good money selling potions,that old geezer must be loaded, that being said they also tend to know some magic, one mistake and you could be incinerated without ever getting a hit in, how do you intend to deal with him?
15521212.title: the alchemist

choices: you dodge and tackle the man
the spell hits you forcing you to the floor
the alchemist vanishes leaving his supplies behind
155212122.content: Wary of the potential for a long and painful demise you prepare to attack the man from behind, after all he cant cast spells at you if he doesn't know your there. Getting closer you can see the man is a Breton at about fifty years old, his robes possess a faint and ethereal glow confirming your suspicions, you take a deep breath and tense your body in preparation to strike. you leap forward dagger brace in both hands, you've only got one shot after all, best to make it count.At the last second the man pulls away, reacting to your attack with supernatural speed, though not quite fast enough, whilst the dagger doesn't pierce his heart and kill him instantly it does wound him gravely. quick to regain your stance you prepare to strike again, the alchemist is able to regain his footing as well though you're not sure how long he can keep it, he readies a spell and begins to cast.
155212122.title: Kill him and loot the body

choices: Panic and try to find an apothecary at the next town
1552121221.content: Surging forward and veering right, you barely avoid the torrent of lighting pouring forth from the old Breton's hands, the scent of blood and ozone fills the air adrenaline courses through your veins, ready for the final blow you brace yourself and through yourself at your opponent your shoulder slams into his chest with enough force to send the wizard flying, his body crashes to the floor unable to resist your attacks any further. you move closer noting that his robes have lost their glow, you assume that means his powers have waned, though you are still cautious. You begin to loot his body finding a disappointingly small amount of gold, barely ten Septims. He isn't wearing any jewelry, and doesn't seem to be carrying any weapons, you recover a few potions including a strange purple elixir, Curious you decide to drink it to find out what it does, within seconds you are doubled over as your stomach burns with the heat of a forge, unleashing a savage hunger.
1552121221.title: you dodge, and tackle the man

15521212212.content: Overcome by your hunger you look to the old man finding that he is still alive, this is of little concern to you however. You grab him by the shoulders and bring his head up to your mouth, with no patience left you shove his head inside quickly engulfing it, wasting no time to savor you're prey you continue, making your way past his shoulders and down his chest, within seconds you reach his waist, the coppery taste of blood fills your mouth and overwhelms your senses. Taking deep and needy gulps you arc your head back allowing gravity to take hold, just as quickly as you had started you had finished the old man, your stomach bulging out, stretching your tunic, though this matters little to you as your hunger is sated. With the immediate problem of your appetite resolved you check the old mans pack which had been left on the ground before your attack, inside you find a map with a location marked 'home', its only a half hours walk from here and may house the rest of your preys wealth.
15521212212.title: eat the old man

choices: Take a rest, you deserve it
loot and leave you don't know if anyone else lives here
155212122121.content: you begin the journey to the old mans home, fortunately it lies in the same direction as Riften making your journey a bit more convenient. Whilst you walk your stomach begins to churn as it sets to work breaking your meal down, your thoughts wander, you had heard of people with the ability to devour others before though you had never seen it. you assumed that it was simply a story children were told in order to make them behave. the extra weight made your walk difficult, your balance had been thrown off, you were in no condition to fight, concerned about the potential for an ambush by an ambitious thief or bandit you hurried along until you reached the old mans home. it was a small cottage hidden off the path, seclude by rocks and thick brush. Upon entering you find the building has two rooms a main hall which you were now stood in and a bedroom at the far side, tired you feel like you could do with a rest, though a voice in the back of your head urges you to rob the place and leave.
155212122121.title: head to the house

choices: Attack Perulmus he enters the room
1552121221211.content:
you enter the bedroom to find yet another door to the side, upon investigation you find another bedroom dominated by a huge bed, the room has no windows unlike the others. you close the doors locking the entrances with keys you find about the home and head to bed, the gurgling of your stomach lulling you to sleep.


a few hours later you are woken by the sound of talking outside, you can hear a man and woman's voice nearby, though you cant make out what they are saying, the front door is unlocked confirming your fears, and the two enter the building.
" it's fine Perulmus it's only a small scratch"

"yes, a small scratch from a skeever, if you don't let me treat it you'll get rock joint Sybille"

You watch from a crack in the door as a young Breton enters the room adjacent to yours, this must be Perulmus, you watch as he turns towards the door to your room and approaches. what do you do?
1552121221211.title: Take a rest, you deserve it

choices: You attack but fail to subdue Perulmus
15521212212112.content:
You take cover to the side of the door, dagger in hand, your heart is pounding, you silently pray that your stomach doesn't give away your position, despite having shrunk significantly you can still feel that its active, and at any moment it could make noises and give away your position. Perulmus opens the door and enters the room, he looks to be about 5 and a half feet tall, with a broad and muscular body. You tense up, and slow your breathing, preparing to attack him in the same manner as you attacked the Alchemist,

you take a step forward, when suddenly

GRROOWL

your stomachs growling alerts Perulmus to your position, What happens?
15521212212112.title: Attack Perulmus he enters the room

choices: attack using your dagger when she gets close
155212122121121.content:
"Wha-"

you rush Perulmus before he has time to react, covering his mouth and plunging your dagger through his back, into his right lung puncturing it, and preventing him from screaming. his body collapses onto the bed with a soft thump, the commotion has not went unnoticed however,

"Perulmus are you okay?"

Sybille soon rounds the corner, discovering the scene of her brothers murder, as well as his murderer. She prepares an attack, revealing that ,like the old man before her, she is a mage, this time however you don't have time to dodge. a bolt of lighting slams into your chest.

Sybille approaches, your laying on the floor, your muscles burn, making it hard to move, though not impossible, What do you do?
155212122121121.title: You attack, subduing Perulmus

choices: Eat Perulmus and tie up Sybille
1552121221211211.content: You play dead, your hunger is growing again,you still have your dagger in your hands, Sybille moves closer your attack will have to be perfectly executed or this will be the end of you. Sybille steps within range of you, more control has returned to your body, you swing your dagger and slice her across her chest, you follow up with a punch to the head knocking her unconscious, though not for long. What will you do?
1552121221211211.title: attack using your dagger when she gets close

choices: straight to Riften, you don't want to waste much time beginning your new career
15521212212112111.content:
You tie up Sybille before she has the opportunity to wake up and ambush you, once that's done you devour the now lifeless corpse of Perulmus. You belch filling the room with the smell of your last victims digested remains, you set to work looting the place,discovering another room that had been obscured by furniture, apparently the old man was much more than an alchemist, possessing draws full of books and enchanting crystals arrayed before a sinister table that emitted a faint blue glow illuminating the otherwise dark room.

CRASH

You head back to the main hall to discover Sybille trying to escape, luckily for you though your still hungry. you untie Sybille and shove her head inside your jaws taking deep aggressive gulps, quickly passing her shoulders, pinning her arms to her sides. now that she is unable to cast spells you can take your time and savor her, unlike her father and brother, she hadn't bled much from your attacks allowing you to taste her flesh underneath.

Eventually she reaches your already active stomach and begins to thrash wildly, this coupled with the weight in your now huge gut, only arouses you, every wild jab or kick hardening your member. You start to masturbate as Sybille's skin begins to peel, her voice hoarse, damaged by your acids, paying no heed to her plight, you continue , reaching climax soon after, you clench your abdomen the powerful muscles crushing Sybille's ribs and forcing acid into her lungs, soon she will be dead.

you continue your earlier ransacking finding a set of fur armor, which you assume once belonged to Perulmus, as well as an Elven dagger, it's surface possesses an icy sheen, the blade it'self is surrounded by a small cloud of mist, you test it against you thumb, but with even the slightest pressure it almost sliced straight through leaving a thin layer of ice behind it, this could be useful.

the looting continues fairly undisturbed, only halting when your stomach got in the way, by that morning you had cleared out this families coffers, totaling 1203 Septims, in addition to a variety of soul gems and potions that you are confident you can sell for a decent price, your haul is heavy though.

Before you can leave however you have one more matter you must attend to, and that is the disposal of your current "guests", you squat down behind the house and press on your gut , noting that it is covered in a thin layer of pudge, you discover the muscles in your arms and legs have also grown, though only slightly, after a few minutes Sybille and Perulmus have been evicted from you bowels and your free to carry on your journey, donning the fur armor for some extra protection. Where to now?
15521212212112111.title: Eat Perulmus and tie up Sybille

choices: This doesn't concern you, finish up and head to solitude
this could be an opportunity for some quick cash, you're interested
155212122121121111.content:
You decide to head to Solitude, your pack is heavy, and you're sure that you'll find more targets to practice your skills on, during your travels, it would be best to have space in your bag to keep you loot.

You set off, making sure to put some distance between yourself and the cottage as quickly as possible, the air is cool as the sun has only just begin to rise.

after a few hours of marching in silence you reach Dragon's Bridge,it will be mid-day soon and you decide to stop at the inn for some food before you continue your journey. once inside you order a mead and seared slaughter fish, whilst there you over hear to Nords discussing a plan to gather some men to storm a cave being used by bandits, so that they can retrieve a family heirloom, you could introduce yourself to them or you could leave it be, what will you do?
155212122121121111.title: Solitude to sell "your" merchandise

choices: Tell the guards you're there to sell furs and meats you gathered whilst hunting
Show them the gems and claim you found them whilst exploring a cave
Claim to be on secret imperial business requiring you to be in disguise
1552121221211211111.content:
You don't feel like taking on bandits today, you got lucky with your last stunt, best not push it too far.

By evening you've reached the gates, before you can enter however, two guards stop you their stomachs bloated and writhing, clearly your not the only one who can eat others.
"HALT! What is your business here" the guards tone is firm and harsh, putting your nerves on edge
"I'm just a traveler looking to sell my wares" your voice falters, you can their eyes bearing down on you,
" That so, is it ? what are you selling?" the situation is turning sour, it'd be pretty hard to explain how an orc like you came into possession of a large supply of soul gems, whilst being dressed no better than a bandit.
1552121221211211111.title: This doesn't concern you, finish up and hea...

15521212212112111113.content:
" All right, I'm not supposed to tell anyone but, I'm on official business from General Tullius himself" your poker face isn't the greatest but your people have a reputation for honesty hopefully that means something to these men.

" Really, and what might that be?" the guards aren't buying it that easy, but you had expected that
" I'm afraid I can't say, I'm to report to Tullius and Tullius only" you try to keep a straight face, though the sweat on your brow threatened to betray you
" If your telling the truth, show us your emblem, every imperial agent has one"

You think he's bluffing, why would a secret agent carry a badge of office with them, then again you can't be sure. You notice the gates are open wide enough for you to make a break and slip into the crowd, Alternatively you could make a break for it and run away. What will you do
15521212212112111113.title: Claim to be on secret imperial business

155212122121121111131.content:
" Imperial agents don't carry emblems on them during missions"
Whether this is true or not, you can't say, you wouldn't know, however the guards of the Capital city, center of all imperial activity in Skyrim would. You stand there for what seemed like an eternity, the churning of the Guards stomachs, and the din of the crowd behind the walls are the only things you can hear. The helmets hide the Guard's faces depriving you of any information as to whether they have bought into your fabrications, their eyes scanning for any mistake you make, one fatal slip that would reveal you as a fraud. if they had found one you would never know, after a few seconds of silence they apologize and grant you entry to the city.

Once you are past the gates and out of earshot, you let out a deep sigh, having barely avoided a digestive demise. you look around hoping to find a general store where you can pawn off your haul, you also keep an eye out for a tailors shop, having some decent clothes might make you less conspicuous. After a few minutes you have found the shops your looking for and concluded your business, 900 Septims richer and looking the part you head over to the tavern, you notice it wouldn't be too difficult ot pick some pockets whilst you're at it.
155212122121121111131.title: Call his bluff

1552121221211211111311.content: Another run in with the guards is the last thing you need right now, so you head to the tavern, you notice that you can hire whores here when you purchase a room, the thought is tempting, you're still a virgin and 100 Septims is small change to you right now. you can't decide on which woman you'd like to bed however, a young nord with read hair, or more interestingly another orc. you book your room now to make your choice.

BUUUUUUUUUURRRRRPPP!

you let out a thunderous belch, expelling her remaining air and filling the room with gastric fumes, your stomach wastes no time in releasing acids to break her down, the surrounding muscles contracting in order to crush her as tightly as they can rubbing your enzymes into her flesh. you sit back on your bed the weight of your prey and the heat given off by your huge stomach begins to take it's toll as you slip into a food coma, you may not have gotten laid, but you're beginning to think that this is a better alternative. your body continues it's relentless assault as you slumber the nords pleas for help falling on deaf ears as she is slowly ground down into chyme. by the morning she is nothing more than waste in your bowels, leaving you with a small bulge in your lower guts. you leave the inn and prepare for your next move what will you do?

You decide to keep her for a while, after all you paid for a full night, and you intend to collect. Lying back on the bed you let her weight press against you core, the pressure is better than any thing you have felt in your life until this point, you begin to lazily masturbate though, you don't really commit, the sensation of live prey squirming inside you is too much to ignore.

Inside your bowels, your prey is panicking, this isn't her first time in some ones bowels, though she fears it may be her last, Failing to notice that she isn't being ferried to your stomach, she continues to fight in a vain bid for her life. Eventually she can struggle no more and is forced to rest, her muscles ache and her heart is pounding, the sound of her own blood coursing through her veins is deafening, "something isn't right here" she thought to her self, she can't feel the muscles contracting to pull her deeper, instead they are undulating in place, it's rather soothing in fact, are you really showing her mercy, her despair begins to turn to relief and then, bizarrely, arousal, no man has ever been able to overpower her like this, only that bratty nord downstairs, more over you aren't trying to turn her into ass fat, maybe you aren't too bad, exhausted and relieved she begins to drift off to sleep.

You notice your toy has stopped fighting, and whilst he weight is still pleasurable, it's not as good without the struggling, do you let her out or let her rest
1552121221211211111311212.title: Keep her for a while

choices: pay for her freedom and take her with you
Leave her here, it'll be safer
pay for her freedom and give her some money to help her
15521212212112111113112121.content:
you've had a long and hard day, why not go to sleep with a beautiful* women in your guts, she doesn't seem to mind.

That night you both dream, they are strange, lurid, and confusing, both dreams focused around the other in some subconscious ball room dance, spiraling around each other and intertwining, their vivid colours brightening with every intersection.

By morning this has been forgotten, you wake up and let your guest out, she comes round and you expect trouble, instead you are repaid with a deep embrace, leaving you rather perplexed. you begin to talk with this woman, you even learn her name, Uloim, to any other race that would sound outlandish and harsh, but to you it's pretty, and in your opinion fitting. You talk about what you were doing here, how you got to solitude, and where you were going, your guard has been completely dropped. She in turn tells you how she got here and why she works as a whore in a back alley inn, the story is grim, kidnapped as a child and sold into this life by bandits, she could buy her way out, but the price is steep, 1000 Septims.

You could pay it for her, maybe even bring her on your adventure with you. then again you're looking at a life of risky business, you've started to care for her and you're not exactly racing to put her in harms way.
15521212212112111113112121.title: Let her rest and get some sleep yourself

choices: Dragonsreach, the steward is bound to have work for you
The inn, Barkeeps can always point you in the right direction
you've heard rumors of a family feud here, maybe you can lend a hand
155212122121121111131121211.content:
Your mind has been made up, and nothing can change your mind except Uloim herself. You tell her your plan, her face is expressionless, but behind her eyes you can see a spark of life burst into life, she accepts, a her words fulled with hope and excitement, a new chapter of life has started for you both. you pay for her she's free now for the first time since she was young, maybe you're not so bad after all.

you take her to the market to buy her some equipment, despite not swinging a sword in years, you find she is still proficient, well more so than you any way, by the end of your time in Solitude you had lost almost all of the money you had accrued, it was worth it though, you had acquired a partner, and a beautiful one at that, you look at Uloim, if she was beautiful before, than she was magnificent now, she's tall and intimidating, clad in steel armor, great sword slung over her back.

you take a carriage to Whiterun, you don't have much left and you need to save some in case of an emergency. the Guards here seem on edge though they let you pass without trouble, the warmest welcome you've had yet. first though you need to grab some cash, where to first?
155212122121121111131121211.title: pay for her freedom and take her with you

choices: Take the job,4000 Septims is no joke
Decline, 6 v 2 are very bad odds
1552121221211211111311212112.content:
You don't want to start too much trouble, after all you need the work, you get the feeling that keeping Uloim fed will be no easy feat even if she doesn't have your abilities. The inn as a result is the most logical choice.

you enter and ask the barkeep if there's any work available, the local Nords glare at you from their drinks, clearly never having seen an orc like you before, or your partner. You are informed of a bounty place on a local bandit gang, whilst they aren't a large threat, being at most six in number, they have stolen a valuable family heirloom, a necklace that dates back at least two centuries, and the price on their heads is staggering, 500 Septims each if they're are delivered alive, 200 if dead, to one Eldgird Silver-Sword, and of course 1000 for recovering the necklace. your eyes widen and your jaw drops, this is a small fortune for the taking. what do you do?
1552121221211211111311212112.title: The inn,

15521212212112111113112121121.content:
You accept and are instructed to head to Silver-Hollow mines out in the backwoods of the hold. without pause you and Uloim set off, on the way you begin to wonder just how capable your partner is, after all the numbers aren't encouraging, and you aren't very good in a head on engagement, it occurs to you that you're in way over your head, your previous confidence seeping away. Uloim is unaware of this however, and begins preparing for the battle ahead.

You arrive at the mines entrance, taking cover before the sentry has a chance to spot you, you watch from the shadows for a few minutes before your confident that they're alone. You begin to sneak up the hill towards the entrance, using the brush and rocky outcrops to conceal your position, Uloim stays where she is watching for any previously unseen threats. soon you are within 20 feet of your target, a tall and lean wood elf, armed with a long bow, if you hadn't taken cover when you did you would likely be dead.

you brace yourself for the opening strike, you intend to tackle him and choke him into unconsciousness, you give Uloim the signal, letting her know to begin approaching, if you can't incapacitate him, then she is to kill him. You rush forward...
15521212212112111113112121121.title: Take the job,4000 Septims is no joke

choices: she impales the bandit on her sword
155212122121121111131121211212.content:
in the blink of an eye what had started as a perfect sneak attack had derailed into a disaster, the Bosmer had reacted faster than you had anticipated, landing a blow square to your jaw, wasting no time he had swallowed you within seconds, this man was a veteran predator and you were his unwitting prey.

Uloim had seen it all go down, without hesitation she rushed forward swing wildly with her blade, the bandit now encumbered with your weight struggled to dodge, allowing Uloim to land a few glancing blows, but before she could swing again, your captor had loosed an arrow embedding itself in her thigh, she yelled in pain, the noise disturbing the bandits who dwelled deeper within the mines, undeterred she regained her stance and charged again...
155212122121121111131121211212.title: You fail

1552121221211211111311212112121.content:
Uloim surges forward once more, her opponent dead ahead, however just as you had failed before she too was defeated. the Bandit tripped her, using her momentum to send her crashing to the floor, he raised his boot above her head and slammed it against the back of her head using his full weight as well as yours, to strengthen the blow. Too dazed to move, Uloim was helpless as the predator stripped her of her armor and swallowed her whole. Acids had already began to fill the tight chamber by the time she entered further crushing you, coating you with the caustic enzymes. Uloim is to disoriented to know whats going on, her head is wracked with pain, her skull has been fractured. The acids rise quickly, soon submerging your head, the elf's stomach quickly subjecting to hellish agonies beyond your own imagination, it's walls pulverizing your bodies, minutes pass, though to you they feel like centuries, your skin has all but disintegrated, you can feel the acid reach your bones, you scream acid fills your lungs, and then in a single moment everything goes black. Your Bosmeri captor clenches his abdomen killing you and Uloim within an instant, your bodies left to be rendered down as nutrients for the elf, he rubs his bloated stomach as it gurgles away, your liquefied remains draining into his bowels, bringing you to your final destination as fat on his effeminate figure, nothing but padding on his ass.

This is the end of the Thief Durzgo, and the warrior Uloim, the only remains left to be found i a steaming pile of shit left off of the side of the road, your bleached skulls left side by side.
1552121221211211111311212112121.title: the elf trips her

choices: Tell Uloim  that you're going to scout for another entrance
Tell Uloim your going in for a frontal assault
1552121221211211111311212112122.content:
Fueled by sheer fury, Uloim would not be stopped by some dainty elf and his bow, the elf tries to trip her, but Uloim dodges, running her great-sword through his chest, his body falls limp the light fading from his eyes.

You can feel the combat outside, hearing Uloim's voice though heavily muffled, acids had begun to seep into the chamber, when you hear a sick crunch above you, coupled with the slicing of flesh, the stomach walls become lax, you realise that your captor is dead, Uloim had saved you.

Uloim had cut you out of the elf's stomach in short order, the cool skyrim air is as shocking as it is relieving, you have minor burns across you lower body and your clothes are a bit tattered, but other than that your fine, if a little humbled.

"Looks like we're one for one now Durzgo" ,Uloim chuckled a bit, it was quite funny to see you looking just as mortified as she had felt last night. "word of advice, don't go jumping into elf gut's if you don't want to get churned up"

"that was not what happened!" your voice cracked mid way through, betraying your embarrassment, this cracks Uloim up even further.
1552121221211211111311212112122.title: she impales the bandit on her sword

choices: Uloim has dealt with the others
15521212212112111113112121121221.content:
"Really now? Sure you don't want me to come along to make sure you don't get eaten again." Uloim kept teasing, as if to add insult to injury, and to think it was only an hour ago since she was singing your praises.
"I can handle myself you know"
"Don't make me laugh, I'll head in first and draw their attention"
and with that she vanished into the mines leaving the bandits corpse just outside. You began to walk around the rock face searching for a crack large enough for someone to crawl through, Bandits rarely set up in places that didn't have an escape route, after a minute or two you had found it, the remains of a skeever den that had been dug out and turned into a tunnel barely large enough for a man to crawl through, you however would have no trouble navigating it's depths.

you crawl for what seems to be at least 20 meters in the pitch black until you finally spot a light, you had found the bandits stock room, you crawl out of the tunnel and take cover by the door, you can see Uloim down the hall fighting two nords, closer to you is an argonian lining up a shot with their bow, you don't know where the other bandits are, but judging by the blood on Uloim's sword you guess they've been taken care of. Deciding that now is your chance you rush the argonian, you slam them against he wall and begin to choke them out, apparently they had the same idea, as their tail wraps around your neck, squeezing it with bane crushing force the struggle continues for a few more seconds, but eventually you are victorious, you look up to see...
15521212212112111113112121121221.title: Tell Uloim ,  you're going to scout for around

1552121221211212.content: Sybille reaches your position seething with rage, without a word she begins devouring you, you attempt to resist but your muscles are to severely damaged, within seconds shes past your shoulders and has reached your bloated gut, paying it no more she continues to swallow you, occasionally using her magic to sear your flesh on the way down, after what seems like an eternity you reach her stomach, as an inexperienced predator Sybille's stomach takes a while to kick into gear, leaving you at the mercy of it's crushing walls and scalding heat. you can hear Sybille attempt to heal her brothers wounds outside, the use of magic accelerating the digestive process, quickly surrounding you with boiling acids which begin to make short work of your severely injured body. Outside Sybille is able to Heal Perulmus's wounds though his life hangs from a thread, she curses you some more though by this point you are dead nothing more but a lump of meat in her stomach.
1552121221211212.title: surrender

1552121222.content:
A torrent of lightning surges towards you forcing every muscle to contract at once, the pain is too much and you collapse to the floor in a heap, your clothes are tattered and your entire body is engulfed in agony. meanwhile the old man repairs his wounds and collects his belongings.

"i will admit you almost had me there, young man, but a mere bandit like yourself could never defeat a mage of my capabilities, i think i shall turn you over to the guards now, a stay in Solitude's prisons should take care of you"

A bright light surrounds you, and within the blink of an eye you are lying in front of the gates of Solitude, you are quickly taken to a cell in Solitude's prisons and left to rot. What now?
1552121222.title: the spell hits you forcing you to the floor

choices: Take the knife, and help your cell mate
15521212221.content:
You are in no shape to fight or do anything for that matter, you have no choice but to wait out your stay.


so you wait in your prison for three days, over that time you have seen some bizarre and somewhat horrifying sights. as an orc born and raised in a strong hold you have heard only tales of outsiders and their capabilities, many you had dismissed as mere rumor, such as the ability for some individuals to swallow others whole. These rumors have been proven far too real however in this prison, guards commonly devour prisoners, you have to make your escape and soon.

that night a guard comes to your cell, and orders you and your cell mate out, fear rises within you as you realise whats going on, you are taken to a back room and your bindings are cut, without a seconds pause she begins to devour your cell mate, an argonian huntress, who had been imprisoned for poaching on the Jarls lands, you notice that you are out of ear shot of the other guards, you think you can snatch the knife that was used to cut your bonds, off of the distracted predator, but you can also make a break for it, you're certainly fast enough.
15521212221.title: Rest

155212122211.content:
if you want to escape your going to need help, and whilst you don't know much about argonians, you do know that they are powerful warriors. whilst the Nord is busy making a meal out of your cellmate you take her dagger and stab her in the back killing her almost instantly, you set to work freeing the argonian.

"thanks for that warm-blood, whats your name?"
"Durzgo, i'm looking to get out of here , you in?"
" better than staying here"

after taking the guards equipment you both make a break for it, before the guards have a chance to react you have escaped to the outside, your peril is not over yet, you still have to escape the city itself, you could slip out of the gates if you are fast enough or you can escape through the sewers.
155212122211.title: Take the knife, and help your cell mate

1553.content: You rest in a newly-crushed clearing and sigh heavily, your belly packed, swollen and round with prey. Among the wreckage on the road are several wagons left without a trace of the dozens of imperial soldiers, imperial prisoners, or even the numerous draft horses for that matter. Faint screams and squirms emminate from your overstuffed gut. You smile and belch, letting off a smell of death and digestion. A loud gurgling comes from your belly, followed by a groan and some churning. The tightly packed matter in your belly begins to soften, sloshing around as you move.
1553.title: Ruler of all beasts

15532.content: There's always room for more, and even as your prey digests you hear a familiar grumble from within your belly. A second course is in order.
15532.title: Still hungry

155321.content:
Picking up travelers will only fill you up so much, but villages can have up to hundreds of people, surely they will be able to sate your appetite. It only takes a few beats of your powerful wings to take off, within moments your soaring in the open skies, eyes peeled in the hopes of finding a suitable location for your next feast.

an hour later and you have picked out an ideal target, a middling farm town with plenty of prey ready for the taking, you descend breathing fire round the outskirts until all routes of escape are cut off. the banquet begins as you smash through the taverns roof, you take a deep breath sucking the occupants out of the building and into your waiting maw,

GULP!

with one mighty swallow your prey are sent barreling down your throat, where they are met with a bubbling, caustic soup in your stomach, their struggles only intensify your hunger, without a moments break you carry on, the guards are completely powerless to stop you, your scales are too thick for their arrows to do any more than irritate you. Likewise their swords do little against you as they slide of your thick hide. They too are devoured in short order, over a matter of hours the town and all that lived there are devoured, leaving one very bloated dragon in the centre of town, your stomach is now easily twice your own size, and their you lay as you drift of to sleep, the only noise that can be heard is the roaring of fire and the churning of your stomach. in the morning you wake up and ...
155321.title: Attack a village or fort

info.brief_description: The land of Skyrim in a vore state
info.description: Welcome to Skyrim. Enjoy having someone in your belly or you in theirs. Story contains Vore of all kinds, digestion, scat and sex.
